name: Key Findings List
description: Numbered list of prioritized findings with severity markers, used to present research outcomes or audit results in a scannable, hierarchical format with HighlightBox children.
components: Section heading: $heading-04 'Key Findings' or context-specific label
Finding items: ordered list, each with severity tag + one-sentence finding
Severity tag: $label-01 in colored pill (high=$red-60, medium=$yellow-30, low=$green-60)
Finding text: $body-short-01 for concise single-sentence descriptions
HighlightBox children: each finding can expand into a HighlightBox(info) for detail
rules: Maximum 7 findings — more than 7 loses prioritization impact; aim for 5 as the sweet spot
Each finding is exactly one sentence — use $body-short-01, not $body-long-01
Severity tags use $label-01 inside colored pill badges: $red-60 (high), $yellow-30 (medium), $green-60 (low)
Numbered sequentially starting from 1 — numbers use $heading-03 for visual weight
Vertical spacing between findings is $spacing-06 (24px) for clear separation
Section heading uses $heading-04 and sits above the list with $spacing-07 gap
If a finding needs elaboration, nest a HighlightBox(info) below it — never inline the detail
Use colSpan 12 offset 2 to center the list and create breathing room from page edges

printBehavior.pagePosition: preferably within first 3 pages, near executive summary

accessibilityNotes: Use <ol> for the numbered findings list — maintains reading order for screen readers
Severity tags must have aria-label (e.g., aria-label='High severity') — color alone is insufficient
HighlightBox expansions should use <details>/<summary> semantics or aria-expanded
Severity color coding must be paired with text labels — never rely on color alone for meaning
antiPatterns: Never exceed 7 findings — a long unranked list defeats the purpose of prioritized findings
Never write multi-sentence findings — if it needs two sentences, split into finding + nested HighlightBox
Never omit severity markers — findings without severity tags look like a generic bullet list
Never use full-width (colSpan 16) layout — centered offset is essential for scannable reading
Never mix severity color tokens — stick to the three-level system ($red-60/$yellow-30/$green-60)
